name: Stockholm
fun_fact: Fun fact: Stockholm is built on 14 islands connected by 57 bridges, and the Vasa warship museum displays a ship that sank on its maiden voyage in 1628 - it sailed only 1,300 meters before capsizing, and was raised nearly intact in 1961!

hero_dishes.name: Swedish Meatballs (KÃ¶ttbullar)
hero_dishes.description: Small seasoned meatballs with cream sauce, lingonberry jam, and mashed potatoes
hero_dishes.origin_story: Actually brought from Turkey by King Charles XII in the early 1700s - now Sweden's national dish (sorry, IKEA)
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Pelikan, Meatballs for the People, Tradition, Stockholms GÃ¤stabud

hero_dishes.name: Gravlax
hero_dishes.description: Cured salmon with dill, served with mustard-dill sauce (hovmÃ¤starsÃ¥s)
hero_dishes.origin_story: Viking-era preservation method - 'grav' means grave as fishermen buried salmon in sand to ferment

hero_dishes.name: Toast Skagen
hero_dishes.description: Shrimp, mayo, dill, and roe piled on toast - Sweden's most beloved appetizer
hero_dishes.origin_story: Created by Tore Wretman at Restaurant Riche in the 1950s, named after the Danish fishing town

hero_dishes.name: SmÃ¶rgÃ¥sbord
hero_dishes.description: Traditional Swedish buffet with herring, meatballs, Jansson's Temptation, and more
hero_dishes.origin_story: Dates back to the 16th century - the word literally means 'sandwich table'
hero_dishes.where_to_find: OperakÃ¤llaren, Grand HÃ´tel, Den Gyldene Freden (since 1722)

signature_drinks.name: Aquavit (Snaps)
signature_drinks.description: Caraway or dill-flavored spirit, essential at celebrations
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Ice cold with herring, accompanied by drinking songs at Midsummer and Christmas

signature_drinks.name: Fika Coffee
signature_drinks.description: Swedish coffee break tradition with pastries
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Multiple times daily - kanelbullar (cinnamon buns) are obligatory. It's a cultural institution

food_culture_notes: Fika is sacred - twice-daily coffee breaks with pastry are not optional
Ã–stermalms Saluhall is the elegant 1888 food hall for fine ingredients
New Nordic cuisine thrives here - Stockholm has 10+ Michelin stars
